Check in at the reception was fast, polite and very professional. Room was fantastic. The breakfast is very good. The coffee at the breakfast is amazing. Special thanks to Mai Fujii and Julian, for making our holiday more special as is already was. I will be back for sure!

We had a wonderful experience in this hotel located next to metro station in the center of Tokyo.The hotel has a very nice club launch located on the 35th floor with a panoramic wieu of Tokyo.the service is excellent, breakfast is great.we hot a suite on high level that was very clean and comfortable. I'm recommending this hotel and we will definitely going to be back there

Great location, minutes to several train stations. Approx 20mins to Shinjuku, 20 mins to Shibuya via train. Polite staff, spacious common areas. Daily breakfast was beautifully presented, though food option was the same every morning, Need more variety of food. Also, breakfast service staff lacks attention, had to ask for coffee 3x one morning, and 2x another morning. Caters more towards business travellers.

The room was large; I had a king size room with a nice sitting area which was great. The bed was firm and comfortable. The excellent air conditioning was great during the summer heat. However, the bathroom was very small. The finishing and styling of the room were a bit dated.The hotel location a block from the Ginza line was very convenient. Breakfast was excellent; thankfully, it was included in my room rate since I imagine it was not cheap. Hotel staff were very helpful.

Good, big, crowded five stars. Service within the expectations, fantastic breakfasts. Needs a bit modernization. Negative remark on the swimming pool: too much noisy to relax a bit from Tokyo summer. Shuttle bus from and to Narita at convenient price and comfortable.

We stayed here for five nights at the start of our Japan trip. The reason I haven’t given the hotel a five star review is solely because of the problems we had at check in. As Club Intercontinental Ambassadors we were due a room upgrade to a suite. When we checked in we were not given this upgrade and only realised on getting to the room. We therefore had to go back to reception. The error was acknowledged but we were told no suites of this class were available as the hotel was busy. We said this wasn’t acceptable so we went to the club lounge while they tried to sort something out. In total it probably took about an hour and a half to sort out and we were quite tired from our flight. The best they could offer us was to move to a suite after two nights and some points. This was frustrating and inconvenient. However, this aside, we really liked the hotel. The club lounge staff were excellent and the food in the Club Lounge, including breakfast, was very good. Afternoon tea (table service) was served 2-4pm in the Club Lounge. Evening drinks from 5.30pm until 7.30pm which included champagne. The pool was nice but quite busy when we went. Our rooms were very nice. The Club Lounge staff arranged for our luggage to be forwarded to Kyoto. We also arranged a private airport pick up which was very efficient. Not the best start to the stay, but nonetheless we would consider staying again as the hotel was excellent on the whole.

I am a Spire Elite member of IHG group and staying in IHg hotels for over 100+ nights each year for atleast 10+ years in a rowOne thing i will never understand is why does Intercontinental hotels treat Spire members with not so much importance its always about the Ambassador which anyone can buy for a mere 200$ i stay for 100+ nights every year and also bring in atleast 200+ more nights via my business partners but it seems to have no value!Yes the hotel location is great, the rooms , well i have stayed in better ones even in holiday Inn’s or Crowne plaza’s so forMe not so impressive, Service well depends, check in was excellent but i had a small issue and had to solve it and it took the hotel 30 minutes, they made me wait in the lobby to queue behind 6-8 Emirates staff who were checking out, I can never understand why a Spire Elite member has to wait that long!The GM did resolve the issue and i do appreciate that, but i will never understand why i should ever stay in a Intercontinental hotel when i have to choose a IHG group hotels the only reason being when there are no other options like in Tokyo and Intercontinental is the only option where using the Club lounge for Spire is not allowed, come on guys we give you enough business !!The hotel is good but still for a Spire Elite , Intercontinental Hotels treat them like 2nd class citizens and not top tier as it should be !!I am glad i dont give Intercontinental hotels my business atleastGood luck with your attitude!

We spent 7 nights here and were very happy - very good staff, well located, clean & comfortable rooms A little slow on check in when there was no one around- notwithstanding the hotel made up for it and provided complementary breakfast during our stay. Would recommend this property to anyone.

Once again the ANA proved itself to be my favorite hotel when I visit Tokyo. From check in to the room to the amenities everything is 5 Star. More than anything it’s the employees who really make the difference. Make sure if you do stay you sign up for the rewards program. It makes a difference.

It’s my second time to stay in this hotel within one year. I chose this hotel again because of the member benefits as well as the location. Although it is not located in the popular tourist attractions like Ginza, Shinjuku or Ikebukuro, it is near the metro station of a few lines (one line is quite far). As an Ambassador member, I am guaranteed room upgrade. My family of three adults booked a premium room and was upgraded to a junior suite which was newly renovated and we could comfortably stay for 4 nights.The buffet breakfast again had a wide spread of food, both Japanese and western. I will certainly stay there again.

This year’s visit coincided with the cherry blossom days in Tokyo; some “blooming streets” are literally around the corner from the hotel. I like the variety of restaurants in this hotel; the buffet in the main lobby is very good. The staff is friendly, the WiFi speed faster than average and the overall customer experience very pleasant.

I was in Tokyo for a business meeting and had a fairly comfortable stay at this property. It's located just next to the metro and one can quickly get to other parts of Tokyo once you figure out the system. The rooms were the right size with good beds and tea kettles, a safe & iron facilities were provided. The hotel has a medium sized gym with I was always able to get the machines I needed. The breakfast offering is good although it can get busy if you aren't early enough. I also found the concierge very helpful in assisting with travel options. It's a bit pricey but would still consider staying here.

Hotel was quite far away to reach from Narita Airport as the last hotel bus leaves 21.40 and due to a flight delay of one hour we reached the hotel within 2 hours later. Check in at midnight and check out time is 11.00 AM. too early for me. Rooms are old but clean.

My first and last time in Tokyo intercontinental Ana. I'd rather yo stay in Seoul inter Parnas, and take flight to Tokyo to finish my business there and return to Seoul, than staying one night in such hotel. Am a platinum Ambassador, what I faced in this hotel is only disorganisation and unhygienic filthy hotel.You wait for more than 35 minutes for breakfast because restaurant has no sense of organising tables to accommodate mote people.Room was super filthy with smelly disgusting bathroom. As a platinum ambassador I recived no upgrades as if am paying nothing for this membership.On the floor you see weird sticky powder, I don't know whether it's for cocroaches or something else.O huge thick dust layer on tabletops and table lamps, ew. I was picking up my charger from under the bed, and cleaning lady came and took my cup of coffee without noticing me, I thought she will wash it, but NO, she wiped it, the most disgusting thing I've ever seen, I felt like am going to vomit after drinking coffee for three days with this cup.Gym is disasterous, the building I live in has better one, and wonder of wonder, this hotel is five star. All Japan intercontinentals are disaster.Yokohama' s one, I used to bring towel and clean the bedside tables and table lamp.As if it's a standard in intercontinental hotels in Japan to have unfriendly layer of dust and dirt.I wish the could learn from Seoul intercontinentals, or from Jordan's inter, an amazing experience comparing to totally unpleasant one.

This trip i am very unhappy with the service in ANA INTERCONTINENTAL TOKYO. Rooms were not ready when i check in at 6.30pm. I book 3 rooms with the ex GM personal assistant, Miss Kayoko san. She did everything for me. But she resign before i arrived ( she did sent an email to inform me of her resignation) and no one follows through. I am a SPIRE Ambassador member, but it took me more than half an hour to settle my room . The lady at the check me in cannot speak English, her English were bad. It gets us very frustrated. I have no choice but to contact Miss Yuka from the Club floor to tell her my frustration. I knew her from my previous stays at this hotel. She replied me on her off day anf fee ls apologetic. She promised me that she will take care of my booking for my second stay. ( i check out to visit Mt Fuji). So upon my return to this hotel, everything is on order. Yuka san waited for us to ensure that she passes the room key to me ( we booked 3 rooms).My check in service staff needs to be well trained. They are too slow. My compliments to the Concierge team, they are very helpful and quick. House keeping room service were good too.Overall, it is Miss Yuka san that makes the service recovery for me.Salute to Miss Yuka san.THANKS

Been waiting to Check-In n for extra 25m and I’m still not done Thought I’m a royal ambassador that Means the highest of their membership card my day is wasted by the Check-In experience that they talk about And no one here can help or want to help

The room is average size for a 5star type hotel, room rate is truly very pricey w>$300 per night without buffer breakfast, only given a voucher to collect two piece of pastries and a cup of coffee from the bakery store in the hotel.

The ANA Intercontinental Hotel is a Great Place to stay during your business trip. It’s located in the Roppongi District with a lot of good restaurants and bars. Not far away from the Tokyo Tower. It’s worth to walk to the emperor palace further to Tokyo Station and to the Ginza Area. The rooms are great and huge breakfast could be included by booking. Good connection to Narita and Haneda Airport by Shuttle Bus Transfer.

First time staying at this property, but not our first time in Tokyo or staying in this neighborhood. Hotel seemed a bit older, but as most hotels in Tokyo and throughout Japan, very well maintained. Rooms and bathrooms are a bit 'tired', but very clean. Breakfast in the lobby restaurant area was good, staff there was very attentive considering that it seemed to be a full dining room. Had dinner at Pierre Gagnaire one evening, nice quiet dining room, amazing view of the city, excellent service, highly recommend. Only downside of this hotel was that the concierge desk wait times were very long. For a hotel this size, there was usually only one person at the concierge desk. Although they are very attentive with each customer, it took an average of about 5 minutes per customer. I had to wait a little over 10 minutes to be helped with only one customer ahead of me on two separate occasions. I noticed lots of staff walking around, and near the lobby, bell desk, etc. - but each time there was only one person staffed at the concierge desk. Recommend if this location is near your destination, but probably won't stay here again, too many options in Tokyo.

The location is great and was convenient for all business meetings, not far from bullet train station and Ginza and the fabulous restaurants etc. The lobby and restaurants are good and service was EXCELLENT. The main downer is the rooms, they are very small, tired and being honest a bit depressing! My sink and bath tub was marked and stained and everything just seemed a bit dour. I only slept there and so wasn’t a major issue but not up to usual intercontinental standards.

The hotel was pristine and the service was excellent. In Tokyo you have to stay in this fantastic hotel. Perfect location. Wonderful rooms. Incredible staff. Would stay here again in a heartbeat, best location and service at a hotel I can remember.

Nice entrance, lobby area and ground floor. Reception was very slow. Everything worked well and facilities were good. Premium King room good enough but no better than that. Price of 3 drinks in the bar was exorbitant and overall quite pricey for what it is. Not saying "don't go" but there are others.

We stayed at ANA for a week on a family vacation, the hotel is located in a nice area, Metro station is about 2 minutes walking, SevenEleven and few restaurants, pizza bar close by.Huge spacious relaxing lobby with a distinctive lovely smell, checked in with Shoko at the reception, she was amazing, warm welcoming, she's a great example of the Intercontinental professional staff. Doormen always helped with the baby stroller and bags. The concierge was very helpful in assisting us with our daily trips schedule, especially Obana was a great help, very knowledgeable and her suggestions on where to go were spot on.Breakfast was a great choice of everything, even though it can get busy at the breakfast but the service speed was remarkable when ordering a tea or coffee for example.The in-room dining also was always quick to deliver. Nice swimming pool where you can easily spend hours there. Housekeeping was constant and the amenities were nice.The MIXX Bar & Lounge on the upper floor had a great atmosphere and a nice overlook of the city, I enjoyed watching Makoto at the bar doing the drinks mixing, such a scene. Rikio at the bar also provided an excellent service, true professional.All in all it was a very nice stay, I will sure stay at ANA if I ever go to Tokyo as I will definitely recommend ANA to friends and family.
user_name:
nasr5559
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Location:• Centrally located in Tokyo Getting to hotel from airport:• Limo bus from NRT airport every hour costs 3100 yen.Check-In:• No wait. Recognized as Aspire by Sara Buisine at reception. Sara upgraded me to very nice room on a high floor and made sure I had a very comfortable stay at the hotel. Excellent customer service. Elevators: • Sometimes had to wait but usually fast. Room:• 2717. • Large sized.• Clean smell.• Close to elevators but no elevator noise.• Upscale decor.• Solid furnishings in very good condition.• Carpet floor. Desk:• Small-sized desk. • Optical mouse friendly.• Desk lamp. • Two power sockets, one with adapter, at desk height. Desk Chair:• Adjustable. • Very comfortable for work. Phones:• Phone on desk. • Phone bedside.Internet in Room:• Wi-Fi internet access provided with room.• Stable.• Fast.• Compatible with VPN.Room Lighting:• Well lit.• Floor lamp. • Ceiling lights.• Bedside lights.Closet:• Medium-sized closet.• Shelf space in TV cabinet. Safe:• Yes.• Not large enough for laptop. Additional Seating:• Sofa.TV:• On TV cabinet.• Medium-sized.• English language channels include CNN and BBC news.Windows:• Large sized.• Curtains effective at blocking out sunlight.Balcony:• No.View from Room:• Hotel pool, other buildings and roadways.Bathroom:• Small-sized.• Tub and shower combined.• Bidet.• Well lit.• Soap, shampoo, lotion provided daily. • Adequate water pressure.• Hot water always available.• Heated mirror.• Magnifying mirror.• Shaver power outlet.Noise Level in Room:• No noise from adjoining rooms.• Very little noise air conditioner unit when running.• Occasional low street noise.Bed:• King size.• Firm mattress.• Very clean. Room Cleanliness:• Very clean.• Well cleaned daily.Air Conditioning/Heating:• Very effective at cooling room.Alarm Clock and Wakeup:• Wake up calls from reception always on time.Turn Down Service:• No.Complimentary Tea and Coffee in room:• Tea and coffee.Complimentary Drinking Water:• Two bottles daily.Fridge:• Space in as mini-bar.Microwave Oven:• No.Room Service:• Did not use. Breakfast:• Buffet priced at 4000 yen.• Very poorly managed. A lot of time wasted because restaurant staff were unable to calculate the cost of breakfast after applying a corporate discount and see the difference in cost compared to a continental breakfast. On second day had to remind staff several times about the tea I had asked for when first seated and finally got it to go after finishing breakfast. A very poorly run operation considering the price charged and number of staff managing it.Restaurant:• Did not use other than for breakfast.Laundry Service:• Did not use.Iron:• Yes.Trouser Press:• No.Robe:• Yes. Slippers:• Yes.Umbrella:• Yes.Morning Newspaper at Door:• No.Gym:• Did not use.Pool:• Nice pool area but fee charged for use. 20m length. Sometimes a bit crowded, but usually able swim laps.Steam Room:• Did not see. Sauna:• Did not see.Parking:• Did not use.Staff:• Very polite.• Very helpful.Check Out:• Took a lot of time because of incorrect breakfast charges and breakfast charges for which I would have been charged after leaving the hotel not showing on the receipt. Leaving hotel:• Took readily available taxi to meeting location downtown.

A highly recommended hotel in Tokyo , close to many great places to visit in Tokyo , a bit expensive and staff at the restaurants are not very friendly , it is very close to metro station and taxi stop!

Rooms are a bit old but fine overall. Bathroom clearly needs a bit of an overall update but it functions fine. Had a very nice buffet in the evening which I would recommend and the breakfast was also very good. Staff were amazing so overall for the cost I would recommend it.

This is a 5 star hotel located in the right of business district Tokyo. I expected a bigger room size compare to other hotel in Tokyo but turns out it's just same with other, small, compact, but efficient.Even though the lobby area is grandeur. The hotel location itself is a little bit far from the station, we have to walk for 10 minutes in underground to reach the ticket gate, but the front gate tunnel station it's only 1 minute walking. So, I Hope intercon can provide a shuttle bus from major area or station to make it easy for the guests.

I stayed here again recently on business for 3 nights. I've been staying here regularly for years. My thanks to Julian for assisting with the early check-in as I had to get to a meeting quickly. Fantastic service, good gym, the rooms do need an upgrade, but i believe that is now underway, from top to bottom.

+ Excellent location. As central as you can get and just a few steps from the Tameiko-Sanno / Kokkai-Gijidomae Metro Station with Chidoya, Marunouchi, Ginza and Namboku Lines.- The hotel itself very much your ordinary business hotel, albeit with a rather antiquated architecture and decor. Not tastefully old. Just outdated, characterised by low ceilings, overall dark tones throughout the building, dim lights, smelly corridors and baths, and odd bits of broken/worn out furniture. While our room (Double on 12F) was quite large for Tokyo scale, it suffered from nearly all the problems. With poor ventilation, dirty carpet, and a broken nightstand. Not horrible, but also not what you expect from a 5 star establishment. - The hospitality side could also use a step up. While the staff were generally friendly and professional, they also felt somewhat cold and stiff. Cleaners for instance would not return our greetings and instead walks away. Once again, not terrible, but also not as refined as you might find in other hotels.- - - ¥4000 pool charge during summer months (7000 for visitors). In all my time travelling around, I’ve never come across a hotel, and a 5 star nonetheless, that charges guests for pool use. I’ve stayed in quite a few hotels, from 2 stars shacks to Four Seasons, but this level of lecherous capitalism is a first.Conclusion:  + An affordable 5 star hotel in great central location. - Makes you question whether it truly deserves those 5 stars with its outdated hardware and questionable business model.

This is a large city-center hotel in a very good location. We stayed in a suite, which was great as it was oriented with windows along the long wall of the living room, with the bed also facing the window, so the views were great. The club lounge was fantastic, with personalized service for evening cocktails and canapes as well as breakfast. We were in a renovated room, which was in great condition. Concierge was very helpful, and front desk was efficient. Really enjoyed our stay.

Incredibly, I stayed at the Intercontinental for one month. It was a beautiful hotel with tremendous staff service.The facilities at this property were outstanding, especially the gym; however, the pool could do with a face lift.I found all the restaurants at the Intercontinental to be of a high standard, but as with all Japanese restaurants, the coffee was poor.As for the rooms, the beds were comfortable and there was a variety of pillows to choose from. The only downside is that the bathrooms could do with a renovation or a good dose of bleach.Nearby, there are multitude of quality, reasonably priced restaurants. Do not be afraid to head out and explore.I’d recommend this property to any business travelers bound for Tokyo.

We recently had the most wonderful stay at the Intercontinental ANA Hotel. It is in a great location, is clean and spacious and has lots of interesting restaurants nearby. There are nearby supermarkets, care and laundromat making a family holiday easier. Highly recommend a stay here. Only downside is it costs around $50 AUD per person per entry to the pool.

I booked online for a business trip and added a few days and brought my husband. It was very expensive per night - but I saw this as a treat and an oasis in Tokyo! I booked a deluxe king. We arrived at the hotel to find that we had a choice of either twin beds in non smoking or a king in smoking. We reluctantly chose the king. Ok the place stunk. It was grotty. It was truly the worst hotel experience I have EVER had - and I have stayed in hotels all over the world.

I just arrived Tokyo from a 12hr flight. I checked in, there was a confusion with my room, agent said it was not cleaned yet, the agent called the supervisor and I finally they gave me room 2520. The room at first sight it’s was nice and clean but once I opened the bathroom it smells like sewage, disappointing to have that smell as a first experience of this hotel.I called the desk and they said they were going to call me in a few. It has been 25minutes and I’m in this room waiting for someone to call.

Great location. Right next to the metro stop. Right next to ARK Hill complex which has a small supermarket for sundries. Service was impeccable. The breakfast buffet has great varieties. The rooms are average. The only other place I ate at in the hotel was the lounge and I really would not recommend the food there. I would rather eat at the many excellent little places close to the hotel (see my other reviews) or at ARK Hill to get a taste of the local cuisine. The Pierre pastries were excellent too. However, I would try the Pierre Gagnaire restaurant next time I stay there. Note that the safety deposit box within the room isn't big enough to hold a laptop.

Very centrally located. If you need to go to any place a cab is at the doorstep 24x7 and only 10 mins away from most touristy places. They even arranged a big car for us since we were a group.The staff is excellent and very helpful and polite. We were with family i.e kids and senior citizens and they catered to all our needs. We checked in twice in the same month and the second time we were upgraded to a much nicer room.

Very comfortable hotel with friendly staff. Comfortable bed, clean room and bathroom. Very good food. I did not manage to use the pool or gym so cannot comment. Great location for many business and sight-seeing activities with at least 2 subway lines within 5 min walk. Also only about 20 min from Haneda airport by car.

My husband and I stayed 2 nights in the intercon as I expected,the service was fautless. Very nice room with all amenities and a Nespresso machine. We had a great view of the city from the room. The in-room service was prompt and the food delicious as the wine.The bar on the 32nd floor offers great views and again, the service was impeccable. Japanese hospitality at his best!

I'm staying at the hotel and while it is very nice overall, they charge hotel guests $4,000 yen (close to $40 USD) to use the swimming pool. I travel all of the time for work and have never heard of something so ridiculous!!!

We stayed for 5 nights in the hotel. A grand hotel with easy access to major places of interest around Tokyo.I was attended by Mr. Ahmed Ali during both check in and out and I was pleased.He ironed out some hiccups professionally and courteously.Our only concern is the size of the bathroom which is rather cramp.Otherwise, the breakfast and service from all the staff were great.

The hotel was very nice. Rooms were pretty good. Only thing is that the MTR was quite a walk. We have been used to staying where the MTR was right below or very near to our hotel. Seems like not much of where we wanted to go was within walking distance. We paid extra to get club access because they claim that they have the biggest lounge in all of Tokyo's hotels. Yes, the lounge is big but there isn't anything in there that's worth the extra in club fees. They didn't even have an espresso machine where we can use. We would have to ask the staff for a cup of espresso. Not very convenient. They should go visit other lounges and see how others operate because this lounge is not up to par with the others.

Our room was great, nice view of the city. The bathroom was on the small side but the view from the bathroom and nice tub, toilet, etc made up for it. We enjoyed the style of the room. There were several places nearby to eat. The staff was very helpful. Money exchange machine in the hotel, which made it easy for us to change dollars to yen. The breakfast was awesome, so many options, all done very well. You can have a traditional Japanese with all the options or choose more American style, or mix it up. Beds were comfortable enough. The drinks at the Mixx bar were amazing, best mojito. And the views were great too.

We booked this hotel for 2 nights at the end of our trip around Japan. We have had a really long trip and had been to Tokyo at the start so wanted a bit of R&R before flying home. We checked in to find that the cost to use the pool is £57 for both of us to use the pool. 57!!! If you wanted to use it the next day, yup you guessed it another £57 quid. An absolute joke. I have stayed in other intercontinental hotels before and never have I come across this. I put my bags in my room and went back to the lobby to speak to a manager. He came out and I aired my grievance and he nodded along and said yeah it is expensive. I said to him other reviewers on TripAdvisor have said the same thing, do you not listen to your customers? More nodding but it was a waste of time. So imo you pay alot for a decent size room, a bathroom from 1970, the worst pillows I've ever used and instant coffee. Paid a lot less for a lot better hotels. You have been warned.

Its location is excellent; rooms are much more spacious compared to many other hotels of same price range; views are overall fine (well, it depends on the direction and the floor of the room though.)However, I found a couple of things bothersome. If you want to buy some stuff, you literally have to go out of the hotel for a better variety of goods. Luckily, there is a mall called Ark Hills next to the hotel; but it could be much better if they have a functional store inside the hotel. I stayed in a non-smoking room. The room was clean and fresh. However, once you step in the hotel lounge, especially at night (south gate I guess), you smell unmistakable odor of cigar and cigarettes. No smoking is allowed at lobby. It took me a while to figure out the reason. The air from the top floor bar (or cigar lounge) are channeled via elevators. People smoke everywhere in Tokyo; yet, I do not appreciate the smoking odor especially at a location like this. This hotel probably deserves more than three marks; yet, considering its high rate, I think they should try a bit harder.

After much deliberation decided to use our IHG credit card free night here plus a second night with 50,000 points. If you are too considering this don’t. Our room was a upgrade apparently but it had obviously been used for smoking and cleaners used some chemical to remove the odour, my asthma suffered with this but as we were in only to sleep in the end I only mentioned at checkout. Unless you are here on business stay somewhere else.I had called from the Uk before we left to make sure the two bookings were attached, nope this took 2 visits to the desk to Remedy. Really did not feel special and feel like I was robbed of my points

We recently stayed at the ANA Intercontinental Hotel in Tokyo. It was just great. The staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions in that city and did not push the hotel's restaurants. The rooms were nice size and very clean. Breakfast buffet was extensive and very tasty. Would stay there again if in Tokly.

I spent two nights in this hotel. nice big lobby. standard rooms. nice staff with little English (please be patient). my only problem with this hotel is that they did not honor my elite membership (spire member is treated as any nonmember guest). if I knew, I would book in less expensive hotel.

This hotel ticks many boxes. The infrastructure is excellent. The foyer, the facilities attached , the levels of service etc are all of excellent quality. The restaurants attached are quite expensive and I definately think that to eat guests should go out for better value for money. That said the staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is excellent. The only thing stopping this hotel getting a 5 is that the rooms are a bit tired and need a make over. Carpet is getting worn and all rooms need a lift. We stayed in several just to see but the theme was the same. They are very clean and tidy though. Again the service provided by the staff is excellent.

Don’t waste your time and money in this hotel. It is very very old and dirty hotel. Carpet is dirty ( in the corridor and the room) and the walls in the room are dark and look very dated. The sofa and the furnitures are dirty and broken in some places. The bathroom is very very old and does not look clean. If brief, i would definitly not recommand this hotel, which is not even worth 3 star. If you are used to 4 or 5 star hotels, you will definitly be disappointed as us.

After a mix-up about the reservation, that required over an hours waiting, the Front Office Supervisor, Kyosuke Saito, sorted out the King size bed that we had requested and provided us with a lovely room on the Club Lounge floor. We had a wonderful few days relaxing in Akasaka after almost a month touring Japan. What made the stay so pleasant an enjoyable though, were the staff in the Club Lounge. We couldn't pass up on the opportunity to thank particular members of the Club Lounge team who took great care of us: hostess Ai, who never failed to have a smile on her face, and barman Koyama. Of particular note, though, was the Club Lounge supervisor, who had the place running like clockwork; nothing was too much trouble for M. Cligniez Romain - he really made us feel very special and contributed so much to our enjoyment. Our second visit to the ANA Intercontinental Akasaka, and we hope to return very soon. Thanks to the entire hotel staff for such a memorable stay.

This place was great. Great location. Great service. The concierge helped us get everything we needed out of the experience. The only bad thing is the prices at the restaurants were outrageously expensive.

If you are looking for a good quality, reliable business hotel in the Rappongi area, this is a good choice. The rooms are a good size and everything works and has a nice ambience. There are Lots of eating and drinking choices, and the gym has a reasonable selection of equipment, treadmills etc. Rates are reasonable for the quality.

Intercon in Akasaka is located in the very convenient area of Tokyo in Akasaka. Walkable distance to Roppongi or to Kasumigaseki, and you can find good restaurants and night life near this location, yet you will be able to enjoy the quietness in your own room. Intercon has a very good teppanyaki-style steak restaurant, among other cuisines (sushi, Japanese, buffet, international foods, etc) highly recommended. It is also convenient to get to the airport by the bus, if your flight suits the airtport limousine bus schedule!

I spent an evening here on a business layover. Welcoming, English-speaking staff, excellent breakfast, and terrific location. My room was spacious and whisper quiet. I certainly recommend for business or leisure stays. Top floor has a great bar with awesome views of the city.

We stayed here for a last minute trip, and reached out to the concierge for restaurant bookings. Despite the limited time, they were able to secure reservations for us at high profile restaurants that were already fully booked according to their websites. The room was also comfortable, with great bath amenities from Thann.

I just arrived back from a week stay in Tokyo’s Ana Intercontinental. For further travelers I’d share some pro’s and cons of it:Pros:Amazing location. There’s a lot going on in the area. A great shopping center next by, subway, buses to Shibuya downstairs, taxis outside of the lobby 24/7. Great staff! The staff was extremely amicable. Always smiling and willing to help in any possible way. Delicious Restaurants within the hotel. Award winning restaurants and cafes, conveniently located inside of the hotel. Great breakfast buffet. I’d recommend to get the room/breakfast offered as the buffet is really worth it. There’s plenty of good things Japanese and international to chose from. Cons:The room. We didn’t have a very big room to say the least. I stood with my husband and baby and there was barely room enough to place my baby’s travel crib. The state of the room wasn’t optimal as well, it feels old and not very clean. The rug and bathroom were particularly dirty in our room. The pool area. Traveling with a toddler a visit to the pool is almost mandatory, so when doing so I was surprised of how dirty and cold the pool was. The good thing was that it was a hot day outside so we swam that coldness away fast enough but still the dirtiness was disappointing. Ours was a great stay, I’d definitely recommend the hotel hoping that you get a better room than mine!

I stayed 4 days in this hotel. It’s grand and beautiful, the rooms are spacious and it’s feels like how a 4-5 star hotel should feel. I would try the steak sandwich in the restaurant on level 2. Amazing and best I’ve had.From a location perspective, Tokyo is a very spread out city. At the surface this place seems far removed from the action, but if you get to understand and use the trains, nite there is a station underground from the hotel that takes you to Ginza in a couple of stops where you’ll find all the high end “western” fashion. Then about a ten minute uphill walk into Roppongi is where you’ll find loads of nightlife and little places to eat. Not sure I would stay there again because I was more interested in seeing Akihabara (gaming district) and then Shinjuku is a MUST - feels like what a tourist wants to see in Tokyo and to get to those I ended up in taxis because I couldn’t figure out which line to change at the stations.

I stayed there for the Sakura season at the end of March this year. Though the front desk was full of people to check in, the staffs behind the counter were very clam and professional. Also, there was a Lobby Manager to handle the situation. They have accommodated me for the impossible early check-in which made me feel super comfortable, and this Lobby Manager introduced himself and guided me to the elevator. (never happened anywhere else!) Originally, I planned for two nights but had to shortened to 1 night due to my personal reason, and I was going to give up the points used for second night (I booked with my IHG point). They said "No problem" and returned my points which was just unbelievable for the season.Breakfast was also amazing, so many to chose from, each item was carefully prepared. Location cannot be better than that for Metro and taxis. I totally recommend this hotel for others and will go back myself again.What pleasant experience!

As a IHG Platinum Ambassador member, we had a 2 nights paid stay in the club rooms. One of the best luxury city hotels we have stayed in! I have selected some photographs which I have taken to supplement this quick review. Service:Top notch service especially from Club associates whom we corresponded daily. Many thanks to Ms Yuka from Guest Relations and Ms Ai who sorted out efficiently the room non-upgrades issue I had faced as a Ambassador member upon checking in. We were constantly checked upon on our overall satisfaction with the stay, and in fact we did! Rooms:The renovated club rooms, even for the standard club rooms, are gorgeously appointed. Room space, which seemed to be a rare commodity in Tokyo, was large. Luxurious amenities such as the Ferragamo toiletries were provided. Beds were comfortable and with the memory foam pillows on request, the sleep quality was amazing and we couldn't hear any noise from outside the room.Views from the Room:First night was spent in the basic club room which provided the jawdropping view of the Tokyo tower especially when it is illuminated at night.Second night was spent in a newly renovated junior suite from which we could see Mt Fuji amongst the skyscapers on a clear morning.Club:The best club lounge we have ever experienced in terms of luxury, space, service and food quality. Of particular mention is the Club Breakfast. It offers a wide spread which you could order alacarte, either the Asian spreads or the Pierre Gagnaire breakfast. Of note were the fruits from the buffet spread are of amazing quality (which very few hotels even sadly bother to offer high quality fruits in their breakfast spread).Due to the large space provided in the lounge, it never felt crowded and also because the hotel tightly controls the access to the club floor.Service from the club associates were 5 stars!! Thanks to Romaine, Bernadette, Ms Kim, Ms Ai and many others who made this stay amazing. Summary:In all, if you want to enjoy your stay in this luxury hotel, pay for the renovated club rooms with the club floor access. If there was a point of consideration in this perfect stay, perhaps the management should relook at providing more competitive room rates, aligned with the prices of the club floors of similar luxury hotels in Tokyo. YP Chan

Lovely hotel, with great views if high enough. We were on the 14th floor, view ok, but friends were on the 33rd floor and view was beautiful. restaurants in the ANA were also great. Had Shaba at the Japanese restaurant our last night, my first time, and what an experience. Steak restaurant was also excellent. Also close to subway station.

What a disappointment, I just spent 3 nights at the IC during my honeymoon and was given a twin room. I did ask and insist to have a double room but was told nothing was possible for that matters. I have difficulties to believe that no room change was possible with 844 rooms of inventory.I was traveling with an employee rate and I put their non-flexibility on that fact but still find that hard to justify. The hotel is nothing special (positive or negative) for an IC, say it does the job of a world-class business hotel. The rooms are getting old and the bathroom yet very clean like the rest of the hotel is living its last days (I hope)! Note: we had to extend one night in Tokyo and took an extra night at the same hotel for convenience reason. Only then we managed to get a double room.

Staying here solo, booked a ‘classic’ room based on photos. Arrived and told that as I’m alone, I get an entirely different room type which is essentially a single bed and room the size of a cupboard. Bathroom is so small, one can hardly close the door. Check-in was generally a poor experience and since I had taken issue with the room, did not get any of the features offered to my travel companions. My internet has not worked since arrival.Location is pretty good, staff friendly and breakfast fine.Wanted to change hotels but was going to cost too much in cancellation fees; don’t make the same mistake as me and fall for this hotel’s scam of showing pictures of one room and giving you a shoebox...

Practical, comfy, incredible location, amazing service, amazing breakfast. This really made a difference in our trip. Since we arrived at the hotel, everyone is smiling, everyone is helpful...Congratulations on such a fine hotel.

Some reviews said this hotel is inconvenient when it comes to the subway lines and I feel it is incorrect. There are 2 stations really close, one a 3 min walk and one a 8 min walk, both get you anywhere you want writhing 25 min which flies because the subway is SO much fun to ride here. I NEVER liked the subway in Toronto, Canada, but here the system is flawless and so easy to maneuver. We got the deluxe room and it’s a regular size room day in a downtown Toronto area. Clean and the service is great and the is amazing!Room service is 24hrs and delicious, I didn’t expect much but the pasta was great! Everyone is very helpful and the concierge is very encouraging for you to they the best of everything this city has to offer, not just touristy places, do your research thought, always.

The hotel has lovely spacious common areas with many different and high quality restaurants and a very tempting cake shop (highly recommended!) and other retail outlets. We ate all our meals at the hotel in various restaurants or via room service and could not fault the food. I would highly recommend the steak house and the teppenyaki restaurants. Breakfast is good also. The room is comfortable and relatively spacious by Japanese standards. On returning to Tokyo, the second room had a separate bath and shower, with this bathroom style being much better than the rooms with the bath and shower combined. The standard of cleanliness was very high. The general amenity of the room was high also (robes, slippers, quality of products in bathroom, coffee maker etc). There is a direct route from the hotel to the airports via the Limousine Bus Service. A metro is close by. You can walk to the Tokyo Tower and round the palace region etc. I would stay there again and recommend this hotel.

The hotel is always full of business men, flying crews checking or checking out, but overall a good hotel for one night. The neighborhood is full of interesting dinning places including some Indian restaurants walking distance from the hotel.The bus service is more than convenient going to Narita with of course the local Japanese efficient and punctual touch.

The airport limousine bus drops off directly at the hotel, so transfer was fuss free and convenient after a long flight. Check in and check out were both quick and efficient. Staff were very friendly and helpful throughout the hotel. Our room was quiet and comfortable, so we were always able to get a great nights sleep. Breakfast was excellent, with a great selection of foods. Hotel was a couple of minutes walk from the nearest Metro station, making it easy to access the sites of Tokyo.

Our family were highly impressed with the standard of this hotel. As our booked room was unavailable (due to renovations) we were provided with an upgrade for the inconvenience without us asking! Restaurant choices of high quality, we ate at both the buffet breakfast and teppanyaki restaurants. Just outside of the hotel sits a number of other restaurants (we tried two and were very happy) and a small supermarket. Unsure of how close train is as we opted to use taxi to get about

Easy to reach by Bus knowing that taxi transportation in tokyo is the most expensive in the world ! The hotel asks for 100,000 yen from the airport to this hotel which is arround 1000$ But fortunatley we reached there for about 11 bucks in the bus limosine company inside the airport where you can find the tickets. Great views specially last floor Nice staff and kindDelicous breakfast and cleanNice piano bar I recommend for all other travelers.

The hotel is very modern, clean and comfortable. The service within the hotel was great and all employees were incredibly attentive, friendly and welcoming. WiFi worked well and showers were always hot. Enough amenities in the room to keep you happy. Prices for food/drink slightly expensive compared with the rest of the city, but probably standard to keep in line with the hotel brand. The breakfast was delightful and the buffet lunch/dinner looked good, but we did not try. Happily stay here again - but probably only on business as it is an expensive hotel compared with others in the city.

Intercontinental ANA Tokyo delivers a solid hotel experience without standing out. The rooms are very small but I guess that is true for life in this expensive city where we paid 200 EUR from the airport to the hotel (a world record and not a rip off). They have a couple of decent restaurants, but the sushi place is too expensive for what you get. You can have the same quality for a tenth of the price in the streets. Still, a good and convenient hotel with good location.

First time staying at the Intercontinental here in Tokyo and it was a good one. Clean hotel with friendly staff making sure all guests have a pleasant stay. Only issue I had was with the limousine bus and their frequency heading out to the Roppongi area. After several mtr transfers we were able to find our way to the hotel (was rush hour when we landed and a cab would’ve cost a pretty penny). Rooms are on the smaller side so don’t expect a normal US sized room. Generous amenities inside are offered so that if you forgot to pack a toiletry, I’m sure they’ll offer it. Tons of restaurants nearby and midtown is a short 15 minute walk. Would definitely stay here again in the future.

This hotel is a bit old but has a great location next to the metro. Rooms are tidy and clean. We only had breakfast but it was great and it serves all you need - international and asian food.Friendly staff.
stayed for 2 night, the rooms are good, breakfast amazing,the location is perfect for the first time Tokyo visitor or businessmen,the hotel has amazing restaurants,I would highly recommend this hotel

Arrived at the hotel to be greeted by some excellent staff who throughout our short stay maintained the high standard. Nothing we requested was too much trouble.Our room had all the facilities we required and was very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was tremendous with a great variety of food. The bars were comfortable and a good meeting place. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay again if ever we come back to Tokyo. Many thanks for the warm welcome and the champagne to celebrate our Golden Wedding Anniversary.

I spent over a week in this tasteful hotel while in Tokyo on business. My well-appointed room was spacious (though the double twin beds were a bit odd) and had beautiful views of the city. The shower was amazing—perfect pressure and temperature control. The only complaint I had was with my air-con which intermittently decided not to work, making my room stuffy. Staff attempted to fix the problem, but with little success. The bar on the 36th floor is not to be missed—great drinks and amazing views. Also a fantastic breakfast buffet.

We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. We had a room overlooking the Japanese Diet (DC Capitol) .... impressive.The hotel is obviously very centrally situated. We took the bus limo from Narita airport (about $31 per person) .... very good and door to door.There is a metro station very close to the hotel .... the concierge (very helpful) will sell you a 600 yen pass($6) for the metro good for 24 hours ... so easy ..... thankyou concierge!!Our room had breakfast included ...... MAKE SURE you do this ......the breakfast buffet was wonderful .... could eat American, but could also wonder off into local food We also ate the odd evening meal ...... the choice within the hotel was very good and they looked after us .... one of our party is Gluten free and not only did they provide GF bread, but it was ready for us at breakfast and at the hotel restaurant in the evening.The room was good, clean etc. and had a good view.The combination of location and the good food/choice was excellent....... but the service we received from the front desk, concierge and restaurant staff made our stay an absolute pleasure.I would certainly recommend this hotel ..... thank you We left to take a bullet train .... the Tokyo station is a short taxi ride away

This hotel is massive and apparently one of the most profitable in Asia. Accommodation is fine but dated. Rooms have an old fashioned feel and bathrooms are also old. For example, the shower is still very much attached to the bath. The lifts are also a nightmare and after breakfast one day we had a 20 minute wait to get back to our room. What makes up for this is the service and friendliness of the staff. The staff are excellent. Breakfast is also good with a huge choice but can get busy. The bar on the 36th floor has a stunning view and worth a visit.

We were grateful to have booked into Intercontinental ANA that is 3mins to the Shinagawa train station. It was the perfect location and an easy train stop from the airport, and convenient to catch various trains to the various tourists attractions. It was also the station that was easy to catch the bullet train to other cities like Kyoto, Osaka etc. It is a very busy station, and it is fascinating to witness the wave of office workers that rushed to work in the morning and then home in the evening each day. The hotel is a great Intercontinental hotel, compared to many around the world. We initially were not sure if it was located in a spot that is surrounded by offices. However, the ambience of the reception area and its restaurants with high ceilings and bamboo and pond landscape setting added tranquility to the ambience. We enjoyed all our 8 days of breakfast that was included with the room booking. The spread of buffet breakfast changed every 2nd day, so we looked forwards to breakfast as a family each morning. The housekeeping team is a group that takes pride in their work. A lot of effort is taken to check that the room is refreshed every day.

The hotel is conveniently located near to a metro station and around 15 minutes walk to a lively area called Roppongi. The decor, ambience and breakfast options are fantastic. It reminds one of luxurious Taj group of hotels with an old world charm. Typical of hotels with this class, food options are plentiful and wide ranging. The room was spacious and luxurious

Hotel is located in perfect location with nice view. Nice, quiet area. You do not bump into many noisy tourists/tour groups like other areas. The hotel is next to the ARK Mori building which has the sought-after SUNTORY concert hall and other offices and food halls. We had great time in walking around neighborhood area. It is close to US Embassy as well. The service is excellent. Hotel has option for limo bus for airport transfer. Bus stop and drop off right at hotel curb side. No walking needed. Concierge desk is so helpful with English speaker and clear/detail instruction. The front desk is so accommodating and especially if you are IHG Ambassador member, you will get an excellent care. The train/subway station is 2 min walk from hotel. Coffee shops and convenient store is close by within 2-8 min distance. If you are looking for bike rental, hotel offer complimentary bikes for VIPs/ Top Elite IHG Ambassador members or you can rent it from the building next door for only $2 USD per 30 min. I would come back to this hotel for my next trip. The rate is pretty high compared to other properties but it is a 5 stars quality hotel.

During my trips to Japan (Tokyo, Kyoto, Fujikawaguchiko, Osaka, and Himeji), I stayed here for two nights. This hotel was the worst from all of the hotel I stayed during my trip. Even though you have a Platinum Ambassador, it means nothing when you stay at this hotel. The reason I chose this hotel is due to the location that was closer to the subway station and near major attraction. I was wrong. Even though it was near subway station but it was located at the last exit (Exit 13) once you got out from the train. I bring my mom with me who could not walk so much. To get here, you had to walk so far and lots of stairs. At the end, we used Taxi instead to go to Roponggi (at the same time, to eat at ippudo and ichiran) and take subway from there. Before my arrival, I sent an email request regarding the reservation and the staff, Goro Takechi, replied everything promptly and fast. However, the services were not as good as SPG or Marriott hotels in Japan even though you are a Platinum Ambassador status. I requested for an upgrade during my visit if it was not sold out and I preferred a double bed as I stayed with my Mom to celebrate my birthday. However, he offered me two choices: my original booking (classic two twin bed room) or executive deluxe room (king bed - the next level category room). He mentioned that there was no longer a room with two twin bed room. I thought that even though if I did not ask for upgrade, as a Platinum Ambassador, I should get an automatic upgrade to the next level category room which is the executive deluxe room. I replied him that it was okay to keep my original booking as I preferred two twin bed room. When I checked my reservation again, instead of two people, the reservation changed to 3 people with an extra charge for the 3rd person. I sent him an email regarding the issue and also, told him how disappointing I was as a Platinum Ambassador member and wish I could cancel my booking and stay at other properties. However, I did not have much time left to book at other properties. He then replied that he fixed the charges and upgrade me to Executive Deluxe room with two twin beds. (I thought he just said no more room with two twin beds). Anyway, this will be my first and last time stay at this properties and would not come back if I came back for Japan trip. The services at the receptionist was okay like most reviewers mentioned. However, as I needed to use a Ta.Q. Bin to transferred my luggage to other hotel, the concierge guy was not helpful at all as I could not read Japanese. Even at Grand Nikko Odaiba, the concierge helped me to fill everything. At the end, I asked other concierge guy to help me filled the form for Ta-Q-Bin. The room is dirty and not like most properties in Japan. My mom and I were allergic to dust. While staying here, our body got itchy everywhere. The windows was very dirty and you can see from the picture I attached.Overall, I would not recommend people to stay here. I wish Marriott has more properties with better access to subway and train station which are closer to major attractions. Before I booked here, my first choices are Tokyo Marriott Hotel (far from subway), Courtyard Ginza (Sold out), and The Prince Sakura Tokyo Hotel (far from subway). After stay here, I realized that the Prince Sakura Tokyo Hotel and Marriott must about the same distance from Subway as this hotel from subway station.As I celebrated my birthday during my trip to Japan. All hotel gave me a birthday cake except this hotel that gave me a small box of chocolate (no brand and only 4 pieces). Still, I appreciated their effort. my reservation from a classic two double bed room to an executive deluxe king bed. I rejected the ofo The hotel is located near a Tameike-Sanno subway station but at the last exit (Exit 13) which is about 10-15 minutes walk total to the hotel. It is very unfortunate that I cannot cancel the reservation as the other hotels get very expensive as it is during a peak season and it is only one week left before my arrival.

I am an IHG platinum elite member and usually stay with IHG hotels when I travel, but not in Japan anymore. Pretty disappointing experience all around. No room upgrade, in spite of the fact the reservation was made almost 3 months in advance. Room was small and tired. Allegedly a no smoking room yet cigarette burns were to be found on the night stand. Bathroom was tiny and difficult to manage at the best of times. You know you’re in trouble when the shower is in the bath!!And the wifi?? Terrible. Could not even access the web in the restaurant downstairs - simply not acceptable in this day and age. My work will be taking me to Japan more these days and, unfortunately, I’ll be switching to SPG hotels when there from now on.

Nice location, best breakfast buffet, executive lounge is amazing.Staff are nice however sometimes when they can't offer a smoking room they don't go beyond customer experience and provide a service recovery.The rooms are average a bit old and carpet not very clean, some of the room stinks from carpet.Single rooms are extremely small so be aware of it when you book.

What a great hotel. - fantastic service, location was perfect for me, upgraded to an executive suite which was a fantastic room, ate in a number of outlets all of which were very good. Also the limousine bus goes direct to Narita from the lower lobby. Connected to a complex with lots of cafes and restaurants and also a short walk to convenience stores and the metro.My only negative feedback is that the wifi is terrible - very slow and frequent drop outs, a central Tokyo hotel cna do better.Very comfortable and enjoyable stay!

Amazing hotel in great location! It takes 10minutes with metro to get to the best spots in Tokyo and you can purchase 24hrs metro ticket with the concierge so you don’t have to struggle later on in the metro station! Hotel is amazing, and rooms comfortable !There are all kinds of amenities in the bathroom and minibar is well equipped too! Not mentioning also all the restaurants in the hotel -these are Best of the best!! I can for sure recommend stay in this place !

The Intercontinental hotel in Tokyo came well recommended and it did not disappoint. Located in a great district with shopping mere minutes away by cab and the night life centre mere minutes away by foot. The staff were warm, helpful and resourceful. The rooms itself were a trifle dated but the size for Tokyo standards was decent. The breakfast buffet was superb and the food excellent. Recommended stay for a visit to the capital.

I stayed at the hotel for six nights in April 2017. The best part is the location of the hotel. It is close to the iconic Tokyo Tower which is a major tourist attraction. The hotel is within walking distance of Roopangi, which is known for its nightlife.Coming back to the hotel, the rooms a bit small in size if you compare it to a similar category of hotels in other parts of the world. But I was told by my friends in Tokyo, that room sizes are usually small in Tokyo. The metro station is just few hundred meters away from the hotel, which is a great boon if you want to explore the city without spending a lot on Taxis. Service was excellent and would certainly stay in this hotel, when I am back in Tokyo.

I've spent probably 150 or more nights at this hotel since 1992 and I'm never disappointed. Service is attentive, responsive and polite. The fitness center has recently been renewed and upgraded and is very well-equipped with aerobic machines. Restaurants are predictably a bit pricey but the quality is very good. In any case, the central location provides many dozens of restaurant options within a short walk, and several subway lines have stations within minutes on foot. Those inclined to take a bus to/from Narita airport will happily find the Limousine Bus stops directly at this hotel. Views from the high floors are great, and the only negative I can think of is that the rooms - though comfortable by Japanese standards - are a bit smaller than top/luxury hotels in most other countries.

These folks really know customer services. The rooms are full of amenities such as a hair brush, toothbrushes, an umbrella, bathrobes, slippers, heck they even treat your mirror so that area you use for shaving doesn't fog up after your shower.If Breakfast is included in your room don't miss it as the buffet lay out for the morning meal is not to be missed. For dinner though the buffet is over priced and not very good sadly.Indeed if you stay at this hotel avoid eat at it, the restaurant prices are sky high, but the accommodations rock.

Stayed for 3 nights April 1st-April 4th 2018 after a cruise ending in Yokohama. Tokyo is quite a distance from Yokohama if your doing similar so prepare for an expensive taxi ride of £110/$150 to this or any Tokyo central hotel. We arrived very early at 9.40 am and expected to just drop off bags and head off sightseeing but surprisingly we were allowed to check into our room at 10.00 am some 5 hours earlier than published check-in times - wonderful!Our room was on the 12th floor and was very nicely appointed although the bathroom was a little dated in terms of the bath/shower combination which is tending to be replaced with walk-in showers in similar quality hotels some of which also offer a separate bath and shower! wardrobe and drawer space was a little lacking for a full unpack however, which we didn't need to do but which some travellers might. Ironing board and iron provided alongside japenese style bathrobes and slippers. Toiletries provided in the bathroom were extensive and of excellent quality.House-keeping services were first-class in every respect but particularly in terms of requesting additional bottled water which was complimentary - this arrived within a few minutes on each request!This is a big hotel with 800+ rooms and staff did their utmost to make you feel a valued and important guest. Check-in desk staff were poilte, efficient and supportive as were the superbly informed and helpful concierge team who were there to help until 10.00 pm each night.The hotel offers a wide range of dining experiences bust we only used the Cascade Cafe for buffet breakfast and dinner each evening. Breakfast was superb in terms of the range and quality of food ordered but service beyond the first order of tea/coffee was quite hard to get as the facility was very busy indeed from 7.00 am onwards due to th business/tourist nature of the clientele staying at the hotel. Dinner was again excellent in terms of food choice and quality but again service could have been better bearing in mind that service charge and tax added an extra 20% to each bill and buffet service is not very onerous on staff.Breakfast was included in our room rate but dinner buffet came in around £52 pp on weekdays (more on week-ends) including tax and service. WE chose to eat in each day after long days on sightseeing tours etc which generally got us back to the hotel after 7.30 pm.The weather was glorious throughout and cherry blossom season had already started in Tokyo and had largely finished by April 5th - booking to see this event is impossible as this year it was early and many cruises etc plan for the middle of April. We saw a great deal of cherry blossom around japan from late March and some of the best was at this hotel along the road at the side of this hotel - absolutely wonderful lit up at night so catch it if and when you can.Suprisingly the pool area wasn't open and indeed wouldn't be until June which was disappointing to us given the weather. Our room had sight of the pool area and it looked like this needed a great deal of cleaning etc before opening but it would have been nice to use for a few hours and I note that the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore had iits pool open in early March and the Intercontinental in Kowloon had its pool open in February last year - something maybe for the hotel to think about in the future in terms of guest access in fabulous weather in April!On a negative note, the in room tea/coffee heater was unusable as it was impossible to work out and all instructions were in Japanese! There was very little coffee/creamer provided and no black tea even if we could have heated any water. Thankfully the in-house patisserie/coffee bar at lobby level was excellent but did close at an early 8.00 pm. The bathroom w/c bidet system was brilliant with very clear instructions. The Japanese are fastidious with regard to personal hygiene and we found this so in the majority of shopping malls and even in the many public facilities throughout Tokyo.We chose this hotel mainly for its location and as a pick-up point for all Tokyo sightseeing tours plus we knew and trusted the Intercontinental brand and had used them before. In Japan Intercontinental have a joint venture with ANA airways hence the prefix to the the hotel name. Bell desk services were exemplary and the bowler hatted greeting staff were superbly smart, efficient polite and supportive.The hotel is literally a few hundred yards away from Tameiko-sannay subway station and at least 4 different subway lines - great for your own sightseeing and shopping! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, will definitely stay here again when we return to Tokyo and overall recommend this as the place to stay in Tokyo - expensive but worth it in our opinion

Spent a fabulous 5 night break here with the family - can’t speak highly enough of the hotel and service. We had 2 rooms and whilst things got off to a slightly rocky start with our daughters room not being available for their arrival despite being booked, everything was put right in spades! We had booked club facilities and this didn’t let us down - the club service is exemplary and if there’s a better club I Tokyo then please tell me where. Our room (Junior suite) was spacious and had the most wonderful shower imaginable. Fantastic trip and can’t wait to go back again.

Club Level accommodated and access to the club lounge on the 35th floor. The rooms are nice, bed is very comfortable and a nice shower area. Television has mostly local channels and a few English speaking ones as you would expect. The additional access to the club lounge is very nice. This provides for additional benefits and the breakfast there is a very nice and relaxed way to start your day and starts with you being welcomed at the door by a member of staff in traditional Japanese kimono. Whilst over the stay was very good, I did have one evening of poor room service were the order was delivered wrong and once sent back came back wrong for a second time. A language issue for which my Glasgow accent does complicate. At all other times the room service was very good. Overall I would recommend the Hotel and staff (friendly and professional) and if within budget would suggest the inclusion of club lounge access.

...I would stay here. The lobby reaks. The rooms are nice enough and it is all a bit dated but there is nothing inherently wrong. My main issue is that the stink of the lobby is enough to knock whatever fresh air you have left in your lungs out. I have stayed here on and off for four years for work if need be, but if the choice is mine, I always stay somewhere else. A positive, there are a bunch of phenomenal walkable restaurants steps from the front door. This hotel will do, but it's not an A or even B choice.

Unfortunately the ANA intercontinental never fails to disappoint. I have stayed here many times over the years and it is probably the worst Intercontinental in the IHG group. I travel a lot for work and being an IHG platinum member for many years my loyalty gets the better of me and I keep making the mistake of staying here. The impression they give is they really don’t care for your loyalty compared to other IHG hotels or other hotel groups. Never a room upgrade or anything for continual visits and loyalty. Then comes the latest issue - I checked in only to be told the room i booked is not available and they would have to downgrade me. What makes this worse was that I was accidentally booked to stay the day before this by my company for my weeks stay and they bluntly said within one minute of me being at the counter that I have to pay for the previous night (which I was fine with as It was not their fault) but that was before telling me about to room downgrade. A lower grade room isn’t that big a deal but generally the rooms here are very old and tired and really need an upgrade to be at Intercontinental standard. The food is nothing special, and the service Is average and having recently stayed at the Hilton not far from here the Intercontinental pales in comparison in terms of quality. Thankfully when I’m back in two weeks time for a week I have booked another hotel as this is my last stay here.

I have stayed in Tokyo many times but this is the first time at this hotel. Whilst the hotel is very nice there are other hotels in Tokyo that are better value for money. Most Tokyo hotel rooms are quite small when judged by western hotel standards and the one thing I would say is that these rooms are probably the largest I have had in all my trips. The breakfast is good and varied and although I did not eat otherwise the standard of food looked good. The bar on floor 36 gives great city views and is worth a visit.All in all a really nice hotel if you want true western style but if you are only going to be sleeping in there other hotels offer better value for money. Having said all of that Intercontinental are my favourite hotel chain.

Just had a wonderful 3 nights at the intercon. Would definitely stay there again. They get service right. The restaurants and location is fantastic. Great buffet breakfast. Can’t wait to stay with ING again.

This was my second stay at the hotel. There is a direct bus limousine service from / to Haneda Airport which is very convenient. Going from the hotel can pay for it at the hotel counter. Hotel rooms were good, well maintained and spacious. Nice pillows of various sizes. Service was excellent. Tried the hotel buffet restaurant for breakfast and lunch, a vast array of choices and good food quality.The room had a good view of Tokyo Tower.Free wifi available. I will return to this hotel.

I always thought that Intercontinentals were just a step higher than a Holiday In, but I was pleasantly proven way wrong at this particular property. To begin with, the service everywhere on the property - except for the Champagne Bar - is world class with the guests put first at every corner. Friendly, helpful, welcoming staff everywhere that will bend backwards for you. Great location, walking distance to Rippongi, we even walked to Ginza one day. World class to casual dinning all under the same roof. We got what we found out later was a non renovated junior suite which looked just fine, spacious, up to date with technology, huge clean shower and bathroom. English speaking staff everywhere, taxi always available, helpful concierge and front desk staff. You'd think that for the size of this hotel it would get away from management, but its impressive how everything is so well tuned.It's no Ritz Carlton or Peninsula, but for someone who usually does stay at those hotels I was still highly impressed. We visited elsewhere in Japan and when we returned from 2 days we stayed here again and were upgraded to the Club Level junior suite which had just been renovated and we were the first guests staying in it. Great upgrade, slightly more sleek and contemporary. They only thing they went cheap on was the automatic toilet seat, it was not a Toto, but some imitation which didn't work as well at the Toto we had in the original junior suite. The club level was wonderful - complimentary tea, happy hour with a light appetizer buffet, "front desk" services for club level members only, a light breakfast. There's a metro station across on the streets which is convenient if thats your preferred method of transportation. I have no reason to not highly recommend this hotel - but skip the champagne bar. See my unfavorable review on the champagne bar page.

I stayed in this hotel 5 years ago & again this week . Extraordinary hotel , great service , lavish rooms, reception & concierge . The Japanese restaurants have very good offerings & not to be missed. The breakfast was lavish & had great variety.

furnishing a bit aged but location is perfect! Choose the hotel due to proximity to restaurants and shopping. memory a bit hazy but certainly no complaints w/decent sized rooms for Tokyo. Standard IC fare and service!

This is a beautiful hotel easily reachable by metro. The room was spacious, which is an incredible luxury for Tokyo, and newly renovated (I was worried a little bit because some reviews said that the rooms are outdated). We had a very warm welcome by the staff and got a lot of useful tips from the concierge. The lobby area is spacious and this is where breakfasts and dinners are served. Breakfasts offer an amazing choice of delicious food of all kinds. In the evenings, guests are offered an incredible buffet dinner that includes crabs and other delicacies. No matter how busy our days were, returning to the hotel in the evening was a blissful moment. I am a big fan of the Intercontinental chain and will definitely come back for more.

This hotel is located next to US Embassy where a lot of business people, professionals as well as DIY tourists stay here. I didn't see big tour groups here which I like. A big selection of daily breakfast - Fresh produce (Both Japanese and International style breakfast), friendly staffs, very sufficient to lead you to the table every single time. They are running the strawberry festival promotion this month which is so pretty and delicious.There are 11 restaurants, bars and cafes in this hotel. I love the steakhouse here where serves mouthwatering Waygu beef and delicious avocado smoothie...Yummm! All facilities in the hotel room are well designed. Pay attention to details is definitely the highlight, such as coffee cups, tea cups, tea pot, Espresso coffee machine, Espresso cattle, capsules and water are matched well with each other. Very stylish! Besides that, toilet facility is another highlight, especially the temperature controlled toilet seat. High tech...I love itAll hotel staffs are super friendly and helpful. For example, I left my purse in a taxi one time and I told the hotel staff, they acted on it straight away (Contacted Taxi company and driver) I got my purse back within 30 mins. It is a big hotel, but everything is so well organised and sufficient! I have to say this is definitely one of the best hotels I ever stayed. There are a lot of nice things I want to say about this hotel. I feel been treated like VIP and I enjoyed stay here very much. Highly recommended ANA InterContinental Tokyo Japan.

I have stayed here various times on business trips over the last years. The hotel is excellent in every way: Rooms, Staff, Services, Restaurants and Location. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean. The hotel staff is very attentive even to special wishes. Service is very professional and in line with Japanese standards. There are multiple restaurant options available within the hotel to support diverse tastes. In addition there are many great restaurants in close proximity of the hotel. A special recommendation goes to Pierre Gagnaire Pains eat Gateaux at the lobby level offering great French sandwiches and wonderful looking and tasting cakes. Location is convenient since it’s a stop on the Narita Bus line. The hotel is centrally located in the Roppongi area of Tokyo with easy access to Tameike-Sanno Station (Ginza line). Overall, this is a beautiful hotel that I highly recommend to business and leisure traveler.

Location was very convenient... Walking distance to two metro stations, several food places around that tend to people in the nearby businesses. They offer a bus service to the airport.Really enjoyed the stay there and the staff was wonderful

The suite was well appointed and comfortably designed, but took away a star because the noise from other rooms could be easily heard from the bedroom. The bathroom was very relaxing from the modern soaking tub to brightly lit sink areas to separate makeup table. Wish the makeup table came with its own magnifying mirror. The living room came with a large pull out sofa bed, which was perfect for our son
user_name:
fdtvfan9
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice hotel (huge) gave me an upgrade as a spire member to a decent size room on the 27th floor. Lots of restaurants in hotel, very pricey (breakfast was about 40$ us) didn't try the restaurants went out in Roppongi and found lot's of nice reasonably priced local restaurants.

Located in the financial district, ideal place if you are there for business. Also, close by the main entertainement aereas. You can walk mostly everywhere, if you feel like walking.The breakfast buffet is very nice, but not worth it paying 22 euros on top of the 250 per night, if you hve regular breaksfast. You have a starbucks closed by, very convenient.The rooms are big, and being in a higher floor gives you an awesome perspective of the city. It is true that some rooms need a renewal thought.The gym is good. The hotel is huge and we did not had the chance to properly enjoy it

The best part of my two day stay here was the location. It is within walking distance of tons of bars and restaurants in Rappongi. It is also a short metro ride away from Ginza an upscale shopping district. Other Tokyo sites are relatively easy to access as well since the metro line has a stop right next to the hotel.In terms of facilities the hotel is good but not great. I have stayed in the intercontinental in Singapore, Osaka, and the barclay’s in New York and would rate their rooms all as slightly better than this one. I am guessing this hotel is a bit older. The hotel does have a host of restaurants including two Michelin stared ones which I did not have a chance to try. Overall the trade off in room quality is worth it for the good location in my opinion but if you are looking for a luxurious room you might want to try elsewhere.

Very nice location. Close to good restaurants.Hotel is very nice. Upgraded to premium room - spacious and very comfortable.Lunch at the Teppanyaki restaurant was excellent. Very good service with a smile. Good business hotel

Traveled with a large group of friends in late January. Checked in for 5 nights and opted to have my own room. I have to thank Chihiro (I hope I got her name right!) for setting me up in a wonderful room. It really does pay to be part of the IHC club and I certainly felt valued upon check in. My room was spacious, updated, and comfortable - complete with hot water kettle, tea, coffee, and a mini fridge. I had a wonderful view and a quiet, peaceful sleep every single night.The hotel concierge staff were also incredible. We asked a lot of them during our stay.
